messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
Yes, I think somebody's breaking into my house, please.
Okay, stay on the line. Why do you think someone's trying to break into your house?
I'm upstairs, and I can hear them breaking stuff down there.
What's been broken?
It sounds like glass, maybe a window?
You heard some glass being broken?
I did.
How long ago was that?
A minute, maybe 30 seconds.
Okay. Just stay on the phone. Stay calm. Are you the only one in the house?
I am.
No children or other adults?
No.
You're in the upstairs part of the house?
Yes, in the office under a desk.
Which area of the house did you hear the glass breaking?
The kitchen. Please hurry.
Do you have any weapons in the house that anyone could use?
No.
Where is the kitchen in relation to the rest of the house?
The back side of the house, by the pool.
Do you have any dogs in the backyard?
No, nothing in the backyard.
Okay, I have several officers coming that way. Stay calm; you're doing great. Do you have any idea who could be trying to get into your house?
No.
Do you hear anything else right now?
I don't.
I don't want you to move, but let me know if you hear anything else we need to know about.
I hear something. Oh my god, they're coming up the stairs.
Just stay where you're at. Do you hear someone coming up the stairs?
Yes, with flashlights.
Stay where you're at. Don't make a sound. Do you see them?
They’re right in front of me!
Stay still, don't move. Do not say a word.
What do I do?
Stay silent. Help is right there. Just stay put.
Okay.
Can you still hear them in your house? Are there more than one voice?
There are at least two.
Are they still in the house?
They're leaving the room. I think they heard something outside.
Okay, stay where you're at. I'm going to stay on the phone with you until officers get there.
They're outside the room.
Stay silent. The officers are clearing the house. They will let you know when it’s safe to come out.
They're yelling something.
Are you with the officers now?
Yes, they just got here.
Okay, go ahead and talk to them. You did excellent.
Thank you.
Take a deep breath and breathe. You're safe now. The officers are there with you.
Okay.
You did a wonderful job. Is there anything else you need to tell the officers?
No, they're checking the house.
Okay, take a moment. You did great. If you need anything else, let the officers know.
Thank you.
You're welcome. Bye-bye.
